meanings.definition: A person who steals goods or property.
meanings.sent1: The police caught the jackers red-handed in the store.
meanings.sent2: The jackers broke into the house and took valuable items.

meanings.definition: A device used for lifting heavy objects.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers used a hydraulic jackers to lift the heavy beam.
meanings.sent2: The car had a mechanical jackers in the trunk for changing tires.
meanings.sent3: The tiny jackers may look small, but they can lift tons of weight effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: The jackers stood tall like a mighty titan, ready to hoist any load.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the jackers creaking under the weight echoed through the warehouse.

meanings.definition: To raise the price of something unfairly.
meanings.sent1: The greedy shop owner decided to jackers the cost of the rare item.
meanings.sent2: The company was accused of jackersing the rates to exploit customers.
